title: Château Husson 2015 White (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Brisk lemon-lime acidity adds a vibrant tone to riper, richer apple, pear and tangerine flavors here. It's a robust, densely textured wine but balanced elegantly. The finish lingers pleasantly on a kiss of vanilla spice.

title: Arboleda 2015 Syrah (Aconcagua Valley)
description: A deep nose with ample oak is peppery and lightly herbal, with scents of clove and briary black fruits. The palate on this Syrah is dry, reserved and tannic, but fresh and healthy. Herbal spicy plum, berry and tomato flavors are drawing on the finish.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2013 Estate Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, as well as 32% Malbec, this is a slightly reduced expression of earthy black tea, black currant, toasted oak and sizable tannin. Full bodied, it shows the concentration and density of the vintage.

title: Bibbiano 2013 Vigna del Capannino  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, vanilla and underbrush waft out of the glass. Made entirely with Sangiovese, the concentrated palate doles out ripe black plum, roasted coffee bean and licorice alongside closed-grained tannins and the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink through 2023.

title: Bindi Sergardi 2014 Calidonia  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of red plum, vanilla and a whiff of baking spice set the tone. The dense palate reflects the nose, showing ripe black cherry, mocha and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Boschkloof 2015 Patatsblanc White (South Africa)
description: This Colombard-based white, with 14% Chenin Blanc, is rich and opulent upfront, offering assertive scents of toasted apple, grilled peach, straw and woodspice that are hit by accents of orange blossom, rose and a drizzle of honey. The palate is round and mouthfilling, with opulent, ripe fruit flavors of lemon custard and apple pie. Drink now–2020.

title: Giesen 2014 Single Vineyard Selection Clayvin Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: There's quite a lot of whole bunch stalkiness in this wine, combined with a good lick of new oak. Aromas of cherry, cinnamon and stems lead the pack along with spiced cedar. The palate offers more juicy red fruits and stalky qualities, and while this has some potential to age, it's also drinking just fine now. Drink now–2025.

title: Ancien 2015 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Candied cherry dominates in this densely concentrated wine, its tannins pronounced. Rose petal aromatics contribute a savory underbrush added to by forest, black tea and cardamom characteristics, as lasting acidity provides freshness.

title: AuburnJames 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Coast)
description: Very ripe fruit aromas, a touch of volatility and a bold powerful set of flavors make this full-bodied wine dramatic to taste. It has a firm structure, too, based on good acidity and a considerable layer of fine-grained tannins that easily support all the black cherry and pomegranate flavors.

title: Ballentine 2015 Pocai Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)
description: This nearly 100% varietal wine, with a tiny smattering of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, is given plenty of time in new oak, a distinction that's noted on the palate. Smoky char and meaty bacon are prominently displayed, as black cherry and blackberry mix along a brawny landscape of ripeness and full body.

title: Barnstormer 2016 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Spry citrus and yellow apple aromas lead to a resounding, juicy palate of peach and red apple. Semidry in style, this shows a deft balance of ripeness and acidity, with a light powdery texture on the finish.

title: Domaine du Mas de Rey 2016 Cœur de Camargue White (Bouches du Rhône)
description: Swirls of caramel, cream and spice perfume this unusual blend of Chasan, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng grapes. While dry and light in body, it's a striking white wine with flavors of orange cream and burnt sugar amplified by sunny tangerine acidity. Drink now through 2019.

title: Domaine Raphaël Chopin 2016 Le Ronze  (Régnié)
description: Rich with a dark, firm texture, this is a dense wine. Black fruits, generous tannins and spice are ripe and full. The touch of pepper on the palate hints at the higher alcohol of the wine. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Domaine Sangouard 2016 La Citadelle  (Beaujolais-Leynes)
description: Leynes sees itself as another Beaujolais cru even if its actual appellation is Beaujolais-Villages. Nevertheless, the wines do have individuality, with minerality as well as red-cherry flavors. With crisp acidity as well as plenty of delicious fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Felsina 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Aromas reminiscent of camphor, new leather and exotic spice lead the nose. The tightly wound palate, brooding palate offers dried black cherry and clove set against close-grained tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Ferraud et Fils 2016 Les Charmes  (Morgon)
description: From the Charmes sector of Morgon, this concentrated wine has spiced almond and toast flavors along with warm black cherries. The tannins are still firm giving a dry core. Drink from 2019.

title: Gabriel Meffre 2014 Laurus Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Ripe but slightly muted cherry and plum flavors are accented by hints of olive and bramble. This wine is not deeply concentrated on the palate but juicy and fresh, with fine, feathery tannins accentuating its easy style. Drink now through 2020.

title: Garcia + Schwaderer 2015 Bravado Red (Itata Valley)
description: Soupy noncommittal aromas of grapy black fruits and plastic set up a palate that's showing live-wire acidity but also a full and heavy body. Baked black-fruit flavors are slightly herbal, while this Carignan-led blend of six grapes finishes chewy, dense and sticky, with just enough acidic offset.

title: Giacosa Fratelli 2014 Vigna Gianmatè  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of espresso, oak, licorice and coconut carry over to the tight knit, medium-bodied palate along with dried black cherry and licorice. Assertive, close-grained tannins clench the finish.

title: Gracianna 2015 Estate Mercedes Riverblock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Cherry, grenadine and rose petal mix on the nose of this vineyard-designate, which is creamy and fully rich on the palate, with a touch of gravel. Vanilla shows through on the grip of oak.

title: Greywacke 2015 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)
description: Pale gold in color, the nose is a mélange of melon, stone fruit, strawberry leaf and oregano. The palate is full and rich, with an oily texture and flesh, melon fruit followed by a long, slippery finish.

title: Henry de Floret 2014 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Flavors of fleshy, preserved red cherry and strawberry verge on overripe here. Soft, plush and fruity, it's an easy-drinking wine with a hint of leather and spice. Although not deeply complex, it's comforting and rich, finishing on fine, furry tannins.

title: Henry Fessy 2016  Chiroubles
description: From 50-year-old vines, this wine is ripe and solid with dark black fruit as well as some firm tannins. It has weight, concentration and a strong minerality from the granite soil of this high-altitude vineyard. Drink from late 2018.

title: Hoopla 2015 Chardonnay (Yountville)
description: Melon and fig mark the fruity nature of this wine, which offers a generous helping of oak alongside intense, up-front acidity. Tangerine slices brighten the thick concentration of other fruit and medium-bodied texture.

title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Domaine de la Chaponne  (Morgon)
description: This wine is structured and firm with the classic tannins of Morgon, while red-cherry and banana flavors give a bright texture. The two elements should come together to give an easy, fruit-driven wine. Drink from mid-2018.

title: La Sala 2015  Chianti Classico
description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this opens with subtle aromas of baking spice and black plum. The straightforward palate delivers blackberry jam, white pepper and clove alongside smooth tannins.

title: La Storia by Trentadue 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Tropical and voluptuously full bodied, this wine is oak-laden and ripe in apple, pineapple and mango, with a lemony aftertaste of uplifting acidity.

title: Le Bocce 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of red plum, cedar and espresso while the firm palate offers dried black cherry, toast and licorice. Closed-grained, rather astringent tannins provide the setting.

title: Les Coteaux de Fournès 2014 Les Grès Syrah-Grenache (Côtes du Rhône Villages)
description: While wild raspberry and strawberry flavors are plush and plump in this rich, full-bodied red, hints of earth and bramble lend spicy, savory elegance. It's a round and mouthfilling wine that finishes on fine yet persistent tannins.

title: Lismore 2015 Barrel Fermented Sauvignon Blanc (Cape South Coast)
description: This is a full and rich Sauvy, with loads of cedar shavings and dried straw that frame the yellow apple and lemon fruit. The palate is broad and weighty, with lingering notes of toasty, grilled apple and spiced orange rind that linger on the close.
